Six teachers caught on camera making shocking X-rated comments about pupils have been disciplined - but kept their jobs. 
In footage covertly recorded in a bar, the group of staff can be heard loudly discussing various schoolchildren and whether they would 'f***, marry or kill' each one. 
Sexually explicit comments about a boy with special needs can also be heard. 
The video of staff from Bangor Public Schools has sparked a furore in the US state of Michigan after it was leaked on YouTube. 
MirrorOnline has blanked out the names of children from the audio. Teachers caught on camera playing game of 'f***, marry, kill' about students 
The person who filmed the video has not been identified, but several factors indicate it may simply have been a bystander who overheard the conversation and found it inappropriate. 
At one point a person can be heard asking: "Are they school teachers?" 
The camera is also placed several tables away, but the group are talking so loudly they can clearly be heard across the other side of the room. The footage sparked a furore after it was leaked on YouTube The staff were at Bangor Tavern Bar and Grill when they were secretly filmed (Photo: Google) 
When a pupil's name is raised for the game a female member of staff says: "Ooh, I would f*** [name redacted]" 
In another a teacher says: "Oh I would f***ing kill [named redacted]" 
A school secretary who was part of the discussion has resigned. 
The school board said two teachers have been given written reprimands and four others were given oral reprimands. 
But outraged parents have said the teachers involved should also resign. 
Police were contacted by one member of staff who felt "threatened" by the video. 
But Chief Tommy Simpson told WZZM13 it was a matter for the school to deal with internally. Like us on Facebook
